description: If the temperature in Office 1A rises above 24°C, the system automatically increases the cool air supply.
if the temperature drops below 21°C, it increases the warm air supply.
If the temperature in Office 1B rises above 24°C, the system automatically increases the cool air supply.
if the temperature drops below 21°C, it increases the warm air supply.

if the temperature drops below 21°C, it increases the warm air supply.

if the temperature drops below 21°C, it increases the warm air supply.
If the temperature in Office 3B rises above 24°C, the system automatically increases the cool air supply.
if the temperature drops below 21°C, it increases the warm air supply.
If the CO2 concentration in Conference Room 1 exceeds 1000 ppm, the system will override temperature settings to increase the fresh air supply.
If the CO2 concentration in Conference Room 2 exceeds 1000 ppm, the system will override temperature settings to increase the fresh air supply.
If the CO2 concentration in Conference Room 3 exceeds 1000 ppm, the system will override temperature settings to increase the fresh air supply.
If the relative humidity in the Server Room exceeds 60%, the system automatically increases the supply of dehumidified air.
When the Time_Mode_Controller enters WORK_HOURS mode during the SUMMER season, the system automatically starts the central cooling plant.
When the Time_Mode_Controller enters WORK_HOURS mode during the WINTER season, the system automatically starts the central heating plant.
When the Time_Mode_Controller's day_profile transitions to OFF_HOURS, the system automatically shuts down all central HVAC plant equipment.

If the heat detector in the Server Room is triggered, the gas fire suppression system for that room will discharge after a 30-second delay.
An authorized user can silence all audible horns and visible strobes from the main fire alarm control panel.
An authorized user can reset the entire fire alarm system from the main fire alarm control panel after an event is cleared.
If occupancy is detected in the Main Entrance, the lights will automatically turn on.
If the Main Entrance is unoccupied for 5 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in Lobby 1, the lights will automatically turn on to a default brightness.
If Lobby 1 is unoccupied for 15 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If the natural light level in Lobby 1 is high, the lights will automatically dim to a lower level to save energy.
If the natural light level in Lobby 1 is low while it is occupied, the lights will automatically brighten to ensure adequate illumination.
If occupancy is detected in Hallway 1, the lights will automatically turn on.
If Hallway 1 is unoccupied for 5 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in Hallway 2, the lights will automatically turn on.
If Hallway 2 is unoccupied for 5 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in Hallway 3, the lights will automatically turn on.
If Hallway 3 is unoccupied for 5 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in Office 1A, the lights will automatically turn on.
If Office 1A is unoccupied for 10 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in Office 1B, the lights will automatically turn on.
If Office 1B is unoccupied for 10 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.

If Office 2A is unoccupied for 10 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.

If Office 2B is unoccupied for 10 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.

If Office 3A is unoccupied for 10 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.

If Office 3B is unoccupied for 10 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in Conference Room 1, the lights will automatically turn on.
If Conference Room 1 is unoccupied for 15 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in Conference Room 2, the lights will automatically turn on.
If Conference Room 2 is unoccupied for 15 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in Conference Room 3, the lights will automatically turn on.
If Conference Room 3 is unoccupied for 15 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in the Server Room, the lights will automatically turn on.
If the Server Room is unoccupied for 5 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
If occupancy is detected in the Mechanical Room, the lights will automatically turn on.
If the Mechanical Room is unoccupied for 5 minutes, the lights will automatically turn off.
During off-hours, the automatic turn-on brightness for all Hallways will be reduced to 50% for energy saving.
Using a manual light switch in any room will override the current automated lighting state for that room.
If an authorized face or card is presented at the Main Entrance, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to Office 1A, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to Office 1B, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to Office 2A, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to Office 2B, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to Office 2C, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to Office 3A, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to Office 3B, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to the Server Room, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to the Mechanical Room, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an authorized card is presented at the door to the Roof, the door will unlock for 5 seconds.
If an unauthorized card is presented at the Main Entrance, access will be denied and the camera in Lobby 1 will record a 30-second video clip.
If an unauthorized card is presented at the Server Room door, access will be denied and the camera outside the Server Room will record a 30-second video clip.
If the request-to-exit button inside the Main Entrance is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside Office 1A is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside Office 1B is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside Office 2A is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside Office 2B is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside Office 2C is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside Office 3A is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside Office 3B is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside the Server Room is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside the Mechanical Room is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the request-to-exit button inside the Roof access is pressed, the door will unlock.
If the Main Entrance door is held open for more than 60 seconds, a "door propped open" alarm will be generated.
If the Server Room door is held open for more than 30 seconds, a "door propped open" alarm will be generated.
If the Main Entrance door is opened without authorization, a "door forced open" alarm will be generated and the camera in Lobby 1 will begin recording.
If the Server Room door is opened without authorization, a "door forced open" alarm will be generated and the camera outside the Server Room will begin recording.
The camera in Lobby 1 will record continuously during work hours.
The camera in Hallway 1 will automatically begin recording for one minute when it detects motion.
The camera in Hallway 2 will automatically begin recording for one minute when it detects motion.
The camera in Hallway 3 will automatically begin recording for one minute when it detects motion.
The PTZ camera on the Roof will automatically patrol a pre-defined tour during off-hours.
